The @EnvAgency have been doing a lot of work on a very overgrown Bear Brook reservoir recently with some much needed dredging. It looks awful now but there are already wildfowl enjoying it and once spring is here and there’s more vegetation it’ll be amazing. https://t.co/R9vdfTvUDv

text: RT @WindrushWasp: Tankering sewage around is cheaper than sorting out the causes and the failed sewage system @thameswater  The @EnvAgency…
RT @WindrushWasp: Tankering sewage around is cheaper than sorting out the causes and the failed sewage system @thameswater  The @EnvAgency…

@loosecollie @Wyefarm @bentd76 @EnvAgency It is true our models are struggling with the events we’re getting on both the Severn & Wye recently. We are recalibrating them in light of new data.

We hadn’t seen a 5m flood at Hereford for nearly 20 years, we’ve now had 3 in 18 months.

@DaveThroupEA @Wyefarm @bentd76 @EnvAgency Rainfall in Herefordshire rarely sets the tone. South wye water is gone, it's Welsh water that affects the levels so dramatically.
Needs another dam upstream or we will say goodbye to the Old Bridge in Hereford I think.

RT @CoastSafe_DandC: Wind will drive tidal surges this #halfterm W/E

Check weather & tide before heading out @metoffice 

https://t.co/vCP…

text:
@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency I get too many and badly timed/inappropriately issued. 

I get repeated phonecalls at all times of day/night which insist on being answered/ responded to.

There must be a better system nowadays.
We used to get a nominated responder who phoned downstream.

This is is not great.
RT @WindrushWasp: Tankering sewage around is cheaper than sorting out the causes and the failed sewage system @thameswater  The @EnvAgency…

@Wyefarm @bentd76 @loosecollie @EnvAgency Not until we’ve got an actual peak at Builth. Until then it’s all based on predicted rainfall and is often subject to significant change.

We provide the best info we have at the time.
RT @MLCleaningUp: As the Chair of the @EnvAgency, she is at the forefront of the current environment agenda. Catch up now with this week's…
RT @WindrushWasp: Tankering sewage around is cheaper than sorting out the causes and the failed sewage system @thameswater  The @EnvAgency…

@loosecollie @EnvAgency Are you signed up to receive flood alerts as well as warnings?

The flood alert issued for the Wye in Herefordshire at 10am had predicted peaks & timings for Mordiford & Ross.
@EnvAgency is it normal practice to clear debris grates and seemingly leave the detritus at the site? https://t.co/ZoBzt3oBQV
@bentd76 @loosecollie @EnvAgency @DaveThroupEA They've increased the maximum height at Ross by a metre!!! Surely the modeling would have been more accurate than that.

urls.title: Cleaning Up with Michael Liebreich / Episode 31 - Emma Howard Boyd
urls.description: Emma Howard Boyd is one of the leading voices the UK’s Environment scene. As the Chair of the Environment Agency, she is at the forefront of the current environment agenda. This week, Michael and Emma will discuss everything from recent flooding in the UK to the unique UWC schooling experience.
